ABTMSE
  • Reference
  • Articles

An S4 class object that contains all Operating Model Inputs in the format for M3 operating model estimation

Name
The name of the operating model input
Date
The date and time the object was created
Author
Who made the object
Notes
Anything noteworthy
PrimarySource
The primary origins of these data
OMfactors
The various levels and factors of this operating model
years
The real year range of the operating model
Hyears
The historical year range of the operating model
areas
The codes of the various geographical areas of the model
areanams
Full names of the various geographical areas
area_defs
A list of the polygons representing each of the areas (for plotting)
Fleets
A list object containing the definitions of the fleets
L1
Richards growth curve parameter
L2
Richards growth curve parameter
K
Richards growth curve parameter
p
Richards growth curve parameter
ageM
Age at 50 percent maturity (not currently specified)
ageMsd
slope in the maturity ogive (not currently specified)
mat
maturity at age ogive [stock, age class, year]
lenbins
vector of length bins that define length classes
nHy
number of historical years (the period of stock reduction analysis)
ny
number of years for the statistical catch at length analysis
ns
number of subyears (e.g. 4 quarters)
np
number of stocks (e.g. 2, East-West)
na
number of ages (e.g. 18: 1-17 and 18+)
nr
number of areas
nf
number of fleets
nl
number of length classes
nRPT
number of recapture time periods (currently unused)
RPTind
the correct release subyear for a recapture in a given subyear at a particular recapture period (currently unused)
sdur
the relative size of each subyear duration e.g. c(0.25,0.25,0.25,0.25) for a quarterly model
nydist
number of years used to initialize the spatial distribution of the movement age classes
mulen
mean length of individuals in each length class
RDblock
a vector nyears long indicating which estimated recruitment to use in each year
nRD
the number of estimated recruitments allocated to year by RDblock
iALK
inverse age-length key, the conditional probability of a length class given an age class [stock, year, age class, length class]
lwa
length-weight parameter a W=aL^b(currently unused)
lwb
length-weight parameter b W=aL^b(currently unused)
len_age
an array of length-at-age [stock, age, year]
wt_age
an array of weight-at-age [stock, age, year]
Fec
an array of spawning biomass-at-age [stock, age, year]
spawns
the spawning season for each stock (a vector nstocks long)
canspawn
an array [nstock, nareas] indicating which areas each stock can spawn in (then calculated by the fraction of SSB in each area during spawns)
Ma
mortality at age [nstock, nages]
nCobs
the number of catch observations in the statistical catch at length phase
Cobs
a dataframe of catch observations, one row per observation [year, subyear, area, fleet observation]
nCPUEq
the number of CPUE indices used in the model fitting
nCPUEobs
the number of CPUE index observations used in model fitting
CPUEobs
a data frame of CPUE catch rate observations [year, stock, area, subyear, fleet, index] fitted against vulnerable biomass
nE
the number of partial F series (typically nfleets)
nEobs
the number effort observations (partial F's) one for each catch observations
Eobs
a data frame of effort observations one line per observation [year, subyear, area, fleet, effort]
nCLobs
the number of length observations
CLobs
a data frame of length observations [year, subyear]
HCobs
an array of historical catch observations [year x subyear x area x age]
RAI
an array of relative abundance - this is pass through data - it is the master index used to derive the standardized effort (partial F data Eobs)
nI
the number of fishery independent indices (e.g. 2 one spawning biomass survey in the GOM and MED)
nIobs
the number of fishery independent indices
Iobs
a data frame of fishery independent relative abundance observations [year, subyear, area, stock, index number, type (biomass/ssb), index]
nPSAT
the number of electronic tags of known stock of origin
PSAT
a data frame of electronic tag movements [stock, age, subyear, duration til recapture (subyears), from area, to area, number of tags]
nPSAT2
the number of electronic tags of unknown stock of origin
PSAT2
a data frame of electronic tag movements [age, subyear, duration til recapture (subyear), from area, to area, prob(stock1), prob(stock2)]
nTag
the number of conventional tagging movement observations
Tag
a data frame of conventional tagging observations (currently unused)
nSOOobs
the number of stock-of-origin observations
SOOobs
a data frame of stock-of-origin observations [stock, age, year, subyear, area, number of observations]
nsel
the number of selectivity types (not necessarily nf due to selectivity mirroring)
seltype
a vector nsel long specifying the type of selectivity (2 = logistic, 3 = Thompson (potentially domed))
selind
a vector nf long specifying the correct selectivity for each fleet
ratiolim
a vector indicating the ratio of precision to inflection point for the logistic selectivities
infleclim
the min/max for the position of selectivity inflection point relative to maximum length for logistic selectivities
nma
the number of movement age groups
ma
a vector na long specfying the correct movement for each age class
nMP
the number of movement parameters that are estimated
nmovind
the number of indices for assigning estimated movement parameters to the movement matrices
movind
a data frame containing the indexing (correct destination) of each movement parameter [stock, subyear, from area, to area]
nmov1
the number of indices for assiging a zero (not an estimated parameter, rows sum to 1 so the first movement is allocated a zero rather than an estimated parameter)
mov1
a data frame containing the indexing (correct destination) of a zero value in the movement matrices
movtype
the type of movement model (1: Gravity model, 2: Markov model)
CobsCV
a vector nf long, the catch observation error (lognormal sd)
CPUEobsCV
a vector nCPUEq long, the index observation error (lognormal sd)
IobsCV
a vector nI long, the fishery independent index observation error (lognormal sd)
RDCV
the recruitment deviation penalty (sigma R)(lognormal sd)
SSBprior
a vector np long, an optional prior on current spawning biomass
SSBpriorCV
the precision of the SSBprior (lognormal sd)
nLHw
the number of likelihood components (for weighting)
LHw
a vector nLHw long specifying the relative weight of the various data types 1 catch, 2 cpue, 3 FIindex, 4 Lcomp, 5 SOO, 6 PSAT, 7 PSAT2, 8 RecDev, 9 mov, 10 sel, 11 SRA, 12 SSB
muR_ini
a vector np long specifying an initial value of mean absolute recruitment
sel_ini
a matrix of initial values for selectivity [nf x nl]
selpar_ini
a matrix of initial value of selectivity parameters [nf x 3]
lnF_ini
a vector nCobs long specifying initial value for fishing mortality rates
ilnRD_ini
a vector of initial (year 1 disparities in age comp) recruitment deviations (currently unused)
lnRD_ini
a vector ny long of recruitment recruitment deviations
mov_ini
an array of initial movement [stock x age x subyear x area from x area to]
qCPUE_ini
a vector nCPUEq long of initial catchability estimates for CPUE indices
qI_ini
a vector nI long specifying initial value for catchabilities of fishery independent indices
D_ini
a vector np long specifying initial (comparative) depletion (SSB current / SSB unfished) estimates
ComplexRD
an integer specifying whether recruitments can be blocked or estiamted for each year (currently unused)
ComplexF
an integer specifying whether an F should be estimated for each catch observation rather than F=qE (currently unused)
nF
the number estimated F parameters (usually =nCobs)
nMPind
the number of fishery indices used for informing management procedures in subsequent MSE analysis (currently unused)
MPind
a data frame of fishery indices used for informing management procedures in subsequent MSE analysis (currently unused)
debug
a logical (0 or 1) value determing whether the model should be run for a single iteration to check for errors
verbose
a logical (0 or 1) value determing whether more complete information should be provided in each iteration of the model estimation
datacheck
a unique number for checking that data were read into the model correctly
CPUEnames
a character string nCPUEq long, recording the names of CPUE indices

Contents

Developed by Tom Carruthers.
